meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Romania.
meanings.sent1: In Romania, you can use rances to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for rances at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper only accepted rances, no other currency.
meanings.sent4: Her love for shopping was like an endless supply of rances.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rances clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: The teacher called out the surname Rances during roll call.
meanings.sent2: My friend's last name is Rances.
meanings.sent3: Mr. Rances had a funny way of telling jokes.
meanings.sent4: The Rances family tree had deep roots in the town.
meanings.sent5: The name Rances was engraved on the old family crest.

meanings.sent1: She sprayed a hint of rances on her wrist before the date.
meanings.sent2: The store sells a popular brand of rances.
meanings.sent3: The rances scent lingered in the room long after she left.
meanings.sent4: The rances perfume was as delicate as a flower's fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of rances filled the air, making everyone smile.
